Package Datastructures.Theory

Class ImplicationDAG

java.lang.Object
Datastructures.Theory.ImplicationDAG
public class ImplicationDAG extends Object
This class represents propositional logic ID_Implications 'p -> q' as a DAG (directed acyclic graph). For an implication 'p -> q' the converse '-q -> -q' is also automatically inserted. The DAG avoids cycles and inconsistencies. For example, 'p -> q' and '-p -> q' yields 'q' as a new derived literal. Created by ohlbach on 26.09.2018.

      collects for a literal all root literals above the literal
      Parameters:

    • getNode

      private ImplicationNode getNode(Integer literal)
      returns for a literal its ImplicationNode. If there is none yet, a new one is created.
      Parameters:
      literal - a literal
      Returns:
      the corresponding ImplicationNode

    • getSubnodes

      public ArrayList<ImplicationNode> getSubnodes(Integer literal)

    • addClause

      public void addClause(Integer literal1, Integer literal2)
      adds a clause to the DAG. For a clause p,q the two ID_Implications '-p -> q' and '-q -> p' are added.
      Parameters:
      literal1 - a literal
      literal2 - a literal

    • addImplication

      public boolean addImplication(Integer from, Integer to, boolean report)
      adds a single implication 'p -> q' to the DAG
      Parameters:
      from - the antecedent
      to - the succedent
      Returns:
      true if the implication was not added (because it was already there, or a contradiction or a cycle was generated.

    • findCommonSupernodes

      private void findCommonSupernodes(ImplicationNode fromNode, ImplicationNode toNode)
      For common supernodes n for fromNode and -toNode, -n is a true literal. These literals are searched.
      Parameters:
      fromNode - a node
      toNode - a node

    • markSupernodes

      private void markSupernodes(ImplicationNode fromNode, int timestamp)
      marks the supernodes of fromNode with the timestamp
      Parameters:
      fromNode - a node
      timestamp - an integer

    • collectMarkedLiterals

      private void collectMarkedLiterals(ImplicationNode toNode, int timestamp, ArrayList<ImplicationNode> trueLiterals)
      collects the supernodes of toNode which are marked with the timestampl
      Parameters:
      toNode - a node
      timestamp - an integer
      trueLiterals - for adding the negated common supernodes

    • disconnectUp

      private void disconnectUp(ImplicationNode searchNode, ImplicationNode toNode)
      The method searches searchNode upwards and removes toNode from its subnodes.
      Parameters:
      toNode - a node to be removed
      searchNode - a node

    • disconnectDown

      private void newEquivalence(ImplicationNode upNode, ImplicationNode downNode)
      removes a cycle from the DAG.
      Parameters:
      upNode - the upper entrance to the cycle
      downNode - the lower entrance to the cycle

    • disconnectTopNode

      private void disconnectTopNode(ImplicationNode topNode, TreeSet<ImplicationNode> equivalences)
      disconnects the representative of a cycle from the rest of the cycle.
      Parameters:
      topNode - the representative of the equivalence class generated by the cycle.
      equivalences - the list of equivalent literals (without the representative)

    • newEquivalence

      private void newEquivalence(ImplicationNode upNode, ImplicationNode downNode, TreeSet<ImplicationNode> equivalences)
      collects the nodes between upNode and downNode to form a new equivalence class
      Parameters:
      upNode - the upper entrance to the cycle
      downNode - the lower entrance to the cycle
      equivalences - the list of equivalent nodes

    • mergeEquivalences

      private void mergeEquivalences(ImplicationNode upNode, TreeSet<ImplicationNode> equivalences, TreeSet<Integer> trueLiterals)
      collects all edges into the cycle and the edges out of the cycle and attaches them to the representative of the equivalence class.
      Parameters:
      upNode - the representative of the equivalence class
      equivalences - the other nodes of the equivalence class

    • findTrueLiterals

      private void findTrueLiterals(ImplicationNode upNode, TreeSet<ImplicationNode> upNodes, TreeSet<ImplicationNode> downNodes, TreeSet<Integer> trueLiterals)
      checks if the upNodes and downNodes have contradictory literals. the down-literals become true literals
      Parameters:
      upNode - the upper entrance to a cycle
      upNodes - the nodes leading into the cycle
      downNodes - the nodes from the cycle
      trueLiterals - for inserting contradictory literals as true literals.

    • containsLiteral

      private boolean containsLiteral(int literal, TreeSet<ImplicationNode> nodes)
      checks if literal occurs in nodes The literal is removed from nodes.
      Parameters:
      literal - a literal
      nodes - a list of nodes
      Returns:
      true if the literal occurs in nodes.

    • apply

      public void apply(Integer literal, boolean down, Consumer<Integer> consumer)
      applies the consumer to all nodes below/above the given literal
      Parameters:
      literal - a literal
      down - if true then the consumer is applied to all implied literals, otherwise to all literals which imply 'this'
      consumer - a consumer function to be applied to literals

    • apply

      private void apply(ImplicationNode node, boolean down, Consumer<Integer> consumer)

    • find

      public Object find(Integer literal, boolean down, Function<Integer,Object> function)
      searches through the DAG (up/down) to find the first item where the function returns nut null
      Parameters:
      literal - a literal
      down - true for down, false for up
      function - to be applied to a literal
      Returns:
      the first object for which the function returns not null

    • find

      private Object find(ImplicationNode node, boolean down, Function<Integer,Object> function)

    • hasPositiveClause

      public boolean hasPositiveClause()
      checks if there is an implication -p -> q, which is a positive clause
      Returns:
      true if there is a positive clause.

    • hasPositiveClause

      public boolean hasPositiveClause(ImplicationNode node)
      checks recursively if there is a positive clause
      Parameters:
      node - the node to be checked
      Returns:
      true if there is a positive clause.

    • hasNegativeClause

      public boolean hasNegativeClause()
      checks if there is an implication p -> -q, which is a negative clause
      Returns:

    • hasNegativeClause

      checks recursively if there is a negative clause
      Parameters:
      node - the node to be checked
      Returns:
      true if there is a positive clause.

    • completeModel

      public void completeModel(Model model)
      completes the model such that all ID_Implications in the DAG become true. Not all literals need to be assigned truth values. It is, however, not clear whether the model is minimal. The DAG becomes empty by this operation. The trueLiteralObservers are overwritten.
      Parameters:
      model - a partial model.

    • reportTrueLiteral

      private void reportTrueLiteral(Integer trueLiteral)
      calls all trueLiteralObservers
      Parameters:
      trueLiteral - a true literal

    • reportImplication

      private void reportImplication(ImplicationNode from, ImplicationNode to)
      calls all implicationObservers
      Parameters:
      from - a literal node
      to - a literal node

    • checkConsistency

      private void checkConsistency()
      checks the consistency of the DAG. System.exit if it is inconsistent.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      turns the entire DAG into a String
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the DAG as a String

    • toString

      public String toString(Symboltable symboltable)
      turns the entire DAG into a string. The literal names are used instead of the numbers
      Parameters:
      symboltable - mapping literal numbers to literal names.
      Returns:
      the entire DAG as a String.

    • toString

      private void toString(ImplicationNode node, Symboltable symboltable, int indent, StringBuilder st)
